Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Privacy and confidentiality.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4130
Section (1) An institution shall assure resident and parent privacy and
Description confidentiality and shall protect residents from exploitation.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 10/11/24, the medical team (Detroit Medical Center) had
restrained Youth A. During the restraint, unknown staff were
taking pictures and Youth A's genitals were exposed. Medical
team stated it was against the law to take "child pornographic"
photos.
Investigation On 10/14/24 and 12/17/24, I left a message for Complainant. I
did not receive a return phone call.
On 10/14/24, I spoke to Administrator. Administrator reported
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were at the hospital with Youth A on 10/11/24.
On 10/28/24, I sent an email to DHHS Worker. No new
information was provided.
The following interviews were conducted face to face at the facility
on 10/18/24:
Staff 1 reported she worked at the hospital with Staff 2 on
10/11/24. Staff 1 confirmed she sat in the hospital room with
Youth A while he was there. Staff 1 reported Youth A continuously
was masturbating in the bed at the hospital while the staff were in
the room. Staff 1 reported they verbally redirected him, but he
continued to masturbate. Staff 1 reported Youth A had his blanket
on the entire time but would grab Vaseline (that the nurses gave
him) and place this in his palm and start to masturbate under the
covers. Staff 1 reported she knew he was masturbating because
of the sounds that he made while doing this and because the
movement of his hands and blanket. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 took
pictures on his phone to show the supervisor. Staff 1 reported this
was done to protect them from any allegations that may be made
towards them. Staff 1 reported she felt uncomfortable. Staff 1
reported the pictures were not taken for sexual gratification or for
purposes of pornography.
Staff 2 reported he worked at the hospital with Staff 1 on
10/11/24. Staff 2 confirmed he sat in the hospital room with Youth
A while he was there. Staff 2 reported Youth A continuously was
masturbating in the bed at the hospital while the staff were in the
room. Staff 2 reported they verbally redirected him, but he
continued to masturbate. Staff 2 reported he took a video of Youth
A masturbating. Staff 2 reported a blanket was over Youth A and
2

you could not see any parts of his body other than the blanket
movement and hand. Staff 2 reported he did this to protect the
staff from any allegations. Staff 2 reported that because Youth A
would not stop, both Staff 1 and himself went out into the hallway
and sat outside of his room. Staff 2 reported Supervisor 1 did not
tell him to take pictures. Staff 2 reported the videos were not taken
for sexual gratification or for purposes of pornography.
Manager reported she received a text message from Staff 2 on
10/11/24 stating that Youth A was masturbating in his bed at the
hospital. Manager reported Staff 2 sent her two videos of Youth A
masturbating. Both were about three seconds long in length.
Manager reported that staff are not to take pictures of youth.
Manager reported she felt the videos and texts message were
provided to her to protect the staff at the hospital. Manager
reported she did not feel the videos were taken for sexual
gratification.
Youth A reported he was at the hospital on 10/11/24 for
attempting to hurt himself. Youth A reported Staff 1 and Staff 2
were there. Youth A reported he never felt uncomfortable with
both staff there. Youth A reported he didn’t see anyone taking
pictures/videos of him while at the hospital. Youth A reported he
was shackled to the bed and never masturbated in front of staff
while at the hospital.
Video Reviewed:
I watched the videos sent to Manager’s work phone from Staff 2’s
personal phone. The videos did not have times noted on them but
did show Youth A in the hospital, laying in his bed, under the
covers appearing to masturbate. Youth A’s body was not exposed
in the videos or face. Videos were seconds long. Both videos have
been since deleted from the phones.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1 and Staff 2 personnel files. Both trainings and
clearances were up to date.
• The Confidentiality Policy:
o Identifiable photographs, audio, and/or video-taping
of Spectrum Consumers/Clients for use outside of
service delivery and/or client security/safety
identification purposes are prohibited. Uses within
the program include photographs for identification
purposes, to procure permanency or as part of an
3

internal therapeutic activity. All photos for
identification and service delivery may be taken only
by Spectrum Employees.
Analysis The agency is non-compliant with this rule. The agency’s policy on
confidentiality only allows for videotaping when it is to provide
services to a youth, identification purposes for security and safety
to procure permanency, or internal therapeutic activities. Staff 1,
Staff 2, and Manager reported the video was taken so that staff
were safe from any allegations that could be made against them.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
In interviews with Staff 1 and Staff 2, both reported no one
prepared them for what supervision would be like at the hospital.
Both reported they were told at the beginning of their shift; they
were going to be at the hospital with Youth A. Staff 1 was hired on
6/12/24 and Staff 2 was hired on 5/29/24. Both had less than six
months experience working at the facility, and neither were
provided directions on how to staff a youth at a hospital. The
agency does not have a policy for this situation. Supervision and
treatment of any youth is to be intentional and in accordance with
their treatment plan in all settings. The agency is to provide their
staff with training and policies concerning their programming. Part
of the services the agency will provide at times is supervision off-
site. The agency will need to write a policy pertaining to off-site
supervision.
Consultation: It would be best practice for the agency to outline
in their policy, items to be prepared for each youth before they go
offsite. These may include, but are not limited to, obtaining a face
sheet, calming plan, reason for offsite, supervision
expectations/goal, logging, and emergency contacts for staff.
Conclusion Violation Established
4

licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
